zone.line: Faust
That Parchment, is that of the holy
Whereout a drink the thirst forever satisfies
Happiness hast thou not enjoyed
If it to thee not from thy own soul ?spring
Wagner
Pardon! it is a great ( )
To thy self in spirit times to transpose;
To see, how for us a wise man consults
us
And how we at last so excellent far -(breaks)
Faust
Oh yes! even to thee stars far,
My friend, the times of perishability
Are to us a book with 7 seals.
What you the Spirit of the times call
That is in the bottom the masters own spirit
In the times itself beholding.
This is then truly often a misery
When run you with the first look thereof
